Job Title: Associate Principal Scientist, Flow Cytometry, Translational Molecular Biomarkers

Location: Rahway, NJ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Job Description

Translational Molecular Biomarkers (TMB) is responsible for translating preclinical molecular biomarkers to clinical development across all therapeutic areas and all phases of clinical development at our company's Research laboratories. TMB laboratories leverage a diverse array of technologies to develop biomarker assays to help confirm engagement of therapeutic targets, understand mechanisms drug action, and patient response.

The Flow Cytometry group within the TMB organization is seeking a highly motivated candidate to join our team. The individual will play a critical role in the development and validation of flow cytometric assays that are deployed in support of clinical trials. The candidate for this Associate Principal Scientist position should have strong technical and biological-area expertise in flow cytometry, immunology, oncology, cell biology, and molecular biology. The candidate should also have a strong interest in lab-based assay work. In addition, the successful candidate should have a desire to collaborate closely with out-sourcing partners on the scientific and technical oversight of flow cytometric assays that support our pipeline.

The Individual Will Have The Following Responsibilities

Lead in the transition of biomarker flow cytometry assays from Basic Research to Clinical Development.Design, develop, and optimize flow cytometric assays for all therapeutic areas and all phases of clinical development.Provide technical guidance on fit-for-purpose assay validation.Troubleshoot assay and instrument-related issues.Serve as a subject matter expert in flow cytometry by collaborating with project teams, biomarker leaders, clinical operations, regulatory affairs, scientists, and physicians to facilitate the successful implementation of these assays and execute on biomarker strategies in clinical trials across early and late-stage clinical development.Liaise with external partners and Contract Research Organizations (CROs) to oversee the development and execution of flow cytometry assays.Write memos, final reports and publications summarizing data, and write/update lab SOPs.
Education Minimum Requirement

BS, BA, MS, or Ph.D. in a life sciences discipline (Biochemistry, Immunology, Cell Biology, or related field.)

Required Experience and Skills**: 

A minimum of 12+ (for BS or BA) or 8+ (for MS) or 5 (for PhD) years of clinical laboratory, academic laboratory, or pharmaceutical industry experience.Strong understanding of translational medicine and biomarker development.Extensive knowledge and experience in flow cytometry techniques including panel design, assay development, optimization, and validation, as well as instrument optimization, maintenance, and troubleshooting.In-depth experience in data analysis and interpretation using relevant analytical software tools (i.e. OMIQ, FlowJo, FCS Express, etc.).Proficient project management skills to effectively plan, coordinate, and prioritize activities to achieve project goals.Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.Motivated and able to work independently with strong leadership skills.Ability to execute within a matrixed organization and collaborate with cross-functional teams.

Preferred Experience And Skills

Well-versed in the latest research, industry trends, and technological advancements.Multi-color flow cytometry experience utilizing traditional and/or full spectrum cytometers (i.e. BD and Cytek flow cytometers).Designing and developing the following flow cytometry assays:ImmunophenotypingMinimal Residual Disease (MRD)Receptor OccupancyHigh-dimensional Flow CytometryTILsPhospho-signalingIntracellular Cytokine ProfilingCellular ProliferationExperience working with Contract Research Organizations (CROs) and possess strong skills in clear communication, detailed protocol transfer, quality agreements, regular updates, secure data transfer, regulatory compliance, and effective collaboration.Handling primary cells derived from human tissues.Primary cell isolation techniques such as tissue dissociation, density gradient centrifugation, magnetic bead separation, and/or fluorescence-activated cell sorting (FACS).Establishing and maintaining cell cultures.Performing in vitro/ex vivo differentiation and stimulation functional assays.Providing training and mentorship.

NOTICE FOR INTERNAL APPLICANTS
